review_title: Good place to start your career if you are interested in following a technical path
pros:
Cutting edge technology, cooperative culture!

- Great communicators

- Great work environment

- Helpful employees
Fast paced environment some decent people
cons:
Overworked, underpaid
Way understaffed, very cheap company with everything
They don't treat their employees well.

review_title: Broken promises, bad management, low pay, company outlook=Dismal.
job_title: Regional Education Director in San Diego, CA
pros: The potential to help children exists, but you won't have the tools necessary to accomplish this and you certainly shouldn't expect to be well compensated.
cons: You may help some children but don't count on making any money in the process.  Upper management has no sales experience and lives in a bubble.  Corporate culture is downright bizarre.  Sales is burdened with reports, research, endless meetings of little or no importance, meager commissions, paltry base salary, etc.  Yet, management's expectations are....HUGE (of course)!

pros:
- Progressive and good at recognizing and rewarding talent
- Very competitive salaries and benefits
- Friendly and humble managers who actually listen to and respect employees
- Management seems to have a very clear understanding of goals, and it trickles down well all the way from CEO to low-level managers
- Flexible with days off
- Probably the most intelligently-designed technology platform I worked on.
cons: Everyone e-mails everyone with everything and you end up with hundreds of e-mails a day.

job_title: Regional Education Manager in Carlsbad, CA
pros: Fantastic organization.  I left i-SAFE because my wife relocated out of state.  I still keep in touch with the team and I am very fond of my time there.
cons: The territories are very big.  While this provides a lot of opportunity it is also a challenge to keep up with the demand.

job_title: Education and Training in Carlsbad, CA
pros: Ten years ago this company was a bright light of potential. Good compensation and benefits, and a fairly positive work environment among staff. Excellent, ground-breaking educational materials in the field of internet safety and digital literacy.
cons: CEO is a micro-manager, especially in the areas she does not understand. She frequently yells at employees and displays paranoia. Her small administrative staff bows to her every whim. There is a weird undercurrent of religious fervor - This is a very toxic workplace - avoid at all cost.

pros: Interesting projects.  Lots of support.  Literally helping thousands of school districts and millions of students.
cons: Working here is a demanding schedule. Lots of accountability. And sometimes to much autonomy.

review_title: DO NOT WORK HERE!!!!!!  Only the Really Smart People Leave the Last review must be written by the Puppet Master!!!!!
pros: There are no Pros unless you enjoy being screwed out of your hard earned money!!!!
cons: Just that this place is one BIG CON!!!!! I wouldn't let my dog work here!!!!!

job_title: Professional Development Manager in Carlsbad, CA
pros: Cutting edge company focused on everything digital.  Truly making an impact in schools.
cons: Friday meetings at 4 PM are common. No downtime!
